flawed_nl_solution:
After a year, scheme A will yield 30% of his capital which is (30/100)*$300 = $90<<30/100*300=90>>90
In addition to his capital, he will have $90+$300 = $395<<90+300=395>>395 in scheme A
After a year, scheme B will yield 50% of his capital which is (50/100)*$200 = $100<<50*0.01*200=100>>100
In addition to his capital, he will have $100+$200 = $300<<100+200=300>>300 in scheme B
After a year, he will have $395-$300 = $95<<395-300=95>>95 in scheme A more than in scheme B
#### 95

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 390, not 395. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
